intro: Cotula chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese daisy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with white centers. It is often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits. Cotula chinensis thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
